document.docAuthor: Du, Li-Na, Chen, Xiao-Yong & Yang, Jun-Xing
document.masterDocTitle: A review of the Nemacheilinae genus Oreonectes Günther with descriptions of two new species (Teleostei: Balitoridae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the Nemacheilinae genus Oreonectes Günther with descriptions of two new species (Teleostei: Balitoridae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Oreonectes Günther, 1868
: original description; type species
Oreonectes platycephalus Günther, 1868
; type locality: small stream near the top of the Hong Kong Mountains.

Diagnosis :
Oreonectes
is easily distinguished from other nemacheilines by its widely separated nostrils, tubular flap of the anterior nostril elongated into a barbel-like structure, and the head and caudal-peduncle compressed while the anterior portion of the body is rounded.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 1. Morphometric and meristic characters of
Oreonectes
species.

tr.th: Pelvic-fin rays Caudal fin branched rays
Inner rostral barbel length Outer rostral barbel length

subSubSection.paragraph: Dorsal-fin origin Behind pelvic-fin origin In advance of pelvic-fin Behind pelvic-fin origin
Caudal fin Rounded Forked Forked Eyes Absent Degenerate Degenerate

tr.th: Caudal fin branched rays Percentage of SL
Outer rostral barbel length Maxillary barbel length
Body depth Inner gill raker number (4 specimens)

subSubSection.paragraph: The first number in parentheses is mean; second is standard deviation; - = no data.

Body elongate; head compressed; caudal-peduncle compressed; anterior portion from snout to dorsal-fin origin rounded; interorbital space broad and flat; snout depressed, shorter than the postorbital portion of the head; three pairs of barbels; anterior and posterior nostrils separated by a short distance, and tubular flap of anterior nostril elongated into barbel-like structure; mouth inferior or subterminal; lips thin and smooth; processus dentiformis absent; lower lip with median notch and completely interrupted by longitudinal groove; eyes normal, degenerate or absent; adipose crests on caudal peduncle present.

Air bladder has two chambers, anterior one within bony capsules, posterior one large and free in body cavity (except for
O. platycephalus
in which posterior air-bladder is reduced); intestine straight; branched anal-fin rays 5–6 ; branched pectoral-fin rays 10–12 ; branched pelvic-fin rays 6–7 , or 4 in
O. anophthalmus
; branched caudal-fin rays 15–16 , or 12 in
O. anophthalmus
; caudal fin forked, rounded or emarginate; scales rudimentary or embedded; lateral line incomplete or absent; cephalic lateral-line system present or absent, if present, with 7 preoperculomandibular, 2 + 2 supratemporal pores; color pattern variable: body with many spots in different shapes in
O. polystigmus
; body usually plain, as in
O. furcocaudalis
and
O. microphthalmus
, or with brown basicaudal bar in
O. platycephalus
and
O. retrodorsalis
; body transparent in
O. anophthalmus
and
O. translucens
.

Six species of
Oreonectes
are recognized as valid, including two new species,
O. polystigmus
from Dabu Village, Guilin City, and
O. microphthalmus
from Du’an County, Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region China . All morphometric and meristic characters of
Oreonectes
species are given in
Table 1
.
